title: Graph of magnetic field in cylindrical conductor

content.question: A long, cylindrical conductor with inner radius a and outer radius b carries a current I distributed uniformly over its cross section (the shaded region shown above). Which of the following graphs best shows the magnitude of the magnetic field B as a function of the distance r from the axis of the conductor?

choices.label: A straight line with positive slope begins at the intersection of the axes and extends up and to the right of the dashed vertical line labeled a, near the top of the vertical axis. Starting here is a horizontal line that extends to the right reaching the dashed vertical line labeled b. Starting here is a concave up curve that extends to the right, ending above the horizontal axis near the right end.

A straight horizontal line begins at the intersection of the axes and extends to the right along the horizontal axis, reaching the dashed vertical line labeled a. A vertical line then extends up the dashed line at a, ending near the top of the vertical axis. Starting here is concave up curve that extends to the right past the dashed vertical line labeled b ending above the horizontal axis near the right end.

A horizontal line begins at the intersection of the axes and extends to the right, past the dashed vertical line labeled a, reaching the dashed vertical line labeled b. A vertical line then extends up the dashed line at b, ending near the top of the vertical axis. Starting here is a concave up curve that extends to the right, ending above the horizontal axis near the right end.

A straight horizontal line begins at the intersection of the axes and extends to the right, reaching the dashed vertical line labeled a. Starting here, a straight line with positive slope extends up and to the right reaching the dashed vertical line labeled b near the top of the vertical axis. Starting here is a concave up curve that extends to the right, ending above the horizontal axis near the right end - higher than the right ends of options A, B and C.

A straight horizontal line begins near the top of the vertical axis and extends to the right, reaching the dashed vertical line labeled a. Starting here is a concave up curve extending down and to the right reaching the dashed vertical line labeled b about halfway up the vertical axis. From here is another concave up curve that extends down and to the right again, and ending above the horizontal axis near the right end - similar to options A, B, and C.

content.answer: A straight horizontal line begins at the intersection of the axes and extends to the right, reaching the dashed vertical line labeled a. Starting here, a straight line with positive slope extends up and to the right reaching the dashed vertical line labeled b near the top of the vertical axis. Starting here is a concave up curve that extends to the right, ending above the horizontal axis near the right end - higher than the right ends of options A, B and C.
